instruction: How did the spectral derivative data types improve clustering accuracy in differentiating between live and necrotic/apoptotic cells in the related study?
Output: The spectral derivative data types significantly improved the accuracy of clustering in differentiating between live and necrotic/apoptotic cells in the related study. The raw data showed some differences for one of the three trauma types applied, but it was unable to accurately cluster all the traumatised samples due to signal contamination from the chemical insult. The background subtracted and smoothed data sets further reduced the accuracy, as they appeared to remove key spectral features that indicate cellular health. However, the spectral derivative data types greatly improved the accuracy of clustering compared to other data types. The background subtracted data set, in particular, had both sensitivity and specificity greater than 94%, highlighting its utility in accounting for unknown signal contamination while still maintaining important cellular spectral features.
